conclusion: Determine which container (E, F, or G) the liquid will flow into from each starting point (A, B, C, and D) by tracing the path through the baffles.
Liquid from A will hit the orange baffle first.
The orientation of the orange baffle will direct the liquid towards the right.
After hitting the orange baffle, the liquid will move downwards and to the right, hitting the light blue baffle.
The light blue baffle is oriented to direct the liquid further to the right.
The liquid will then move downwards and to the right, hitting the red baffle.
The red baffle is oriented to direct the liquid to the left.
The liquid will then move downwards and to the left, reaching container F.
Liquid from B will hit the green baffle first.
The orientation of the green baffle will direct the liquid towards the left.
After hitting the green baffle, the liquid will move downwards and to the left, hitting the orange baffle.
The orange baffle is oriented to direct the liquid further to the right.
The liquid will then move downwards and to the right, hitting the light blue baffle.
The light blue baffle is oriented to direct the liquid further to the right.
The liquid will then move downwards and to the right, hitting the red baffle.
The red baffle is oriented to direct the liquid to the left.
The liquid will then move downwards and to the left, reaching container F.
Liquid from C will hit the yellow baffle first.
The orientation of the yellow baffle will direct the liquid towards the left.
After hitting the yellow baffle, the liquid will move downwards and to the left, hitting the orange baffle.
The orange baffle is oriented to direct the liquid further to the right.
The liquid will then move downwards and to the right, hitting the light blue baffle.
